results.content:
Nice insight into line animations, but that's the main thing this course teaches. 

There's more to svg animation. I feel that more planning and preparation could have been done to explain more concepts in roughly the same amount of time spent explaining a single animation type.

I know this course is about £10, so you might ask 'how much can you expect for the price?'. But this is one of the top coding course sites online - I would rather pay more money and get a better course and not waste my time.

results.content: A good introduction to the topic of svg animation in the browser, but very very basic. It would have been nice to have a few more sections that showed these (and more) features being combined into more ambitious projects. And the instructor didn't mention where to find more resources (for example, the spec or MDN pages) for finding more properties to use.

It would have been nice to have a few more sections that showed these (and more) features being combined into more ambitious projects. And the instructor didn't mention where to find more resources (for example, the spec or MDN pages) for finding more properties to use.

results.content: That was an excellent course and it will be one I return to again and again as I experiment with SVG animation. I think there is a real need for short, fast paced courses like this where a concept is covered very quickly and then you move on. There is no need to go too in depth as answers can be found on the internet. This course was very inspiring. I am a vector graphics specialist in the print world and I had no idea I could do this kind of stuff with SVGs and a web browser. This has opened up a whole new direction for me. Thank you.

results.content:
First the good:
Delivery is good and there's a variety of effects shown.


Now the bad:
1> You'd expect a course titled "Learn SVG Animation - With HTML, CSS & Javascript" to have some animation using Javascript... but no.. the ONLY time Javascript is used is to find out how long lines are... it's not actually used in the animations.


2> Lots of do this and do that, little explanation except how to do the line-draw technique.


If you are new to svg animation this course is worth taking, as it is free, to learn how to use css to animate svg's, but that is all you will learn.
results.content_html:
First the good:
Delivery is good and there's a variety of effects shown.

Now the bad:
1> You'd expect a course titled "Learn SVG Animation - With HTML, CSS & Javascript" to have some animation using Javascript... but no.. the ONLY time Javascript is used is to find out how long lines are... it's not actually used in the animations.

2> Lots of do this and do that, little explanation except how to do the line-draw technique.

If you are new to svg animation this course is worth taking, as it is free, to learn how to use css to animate svg's, but that is all you will learn.
